name: DeployIsPacs
description: Deploy your ISPACs to SQL Server
author: Mario Majcica
helpMarkDown: Deploy SSIS ISPACs on your server togheter with environment variables.

inputs.name: ispacFilePath
inputs.label: ISPAC file(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the ISPAC file or on a UNC path like, \\\\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\FabrikamDB.ispac. The UNC path should be accessible to the machine's administrator account. Environment variables are also supported, like $env:windir, $env:systemroot, $env:windir\FabrikamFibre\DB. Wildcards can be used. For example, `**/*.ispac` for ISPAC file present in all sub folders.

inputs.name: ServerName
inputs.label: Server Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the SQL Server name like, machinename\FabriakmSQL,1433 or localhost or .\SQL2012R2. Specifying localhost will connect to the Default SQL Server instance on the machine.

inputs.name: AuthScheme
inputs.label: Authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the authentication mode for connecting to the SQL Server. In Windows authentication mode, the administrator's account, as specified in the Machines section, is used to connect to the SQL Server. In SQL Server Authentication mode, the SQL login and Password have to be provided in the parameters below.

inputs.name: SqlUsername
inputs.label: SQL User name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the SQL login to connect to the SQL Server. The option is only available if SQL Server Authentication mode has been selected.

inputs.name: SqlPassword
inputs.label: SQL Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the Password of the SQL login. The option is only available if SQL Server Authentication mode has been selected.

inputs.name: sharedCatalog
inputs.label: Shared Catalog
inputs.helpMarkDown: If catalog is shared, it will not be dropped durig the deployment.

inputs.name: catalogPassword
inputs.label: Catalog Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Catalog password protects the database master key that is used for encrypting the catalog data. Save the password in a secure location. It is recommended that you also back up the database master key.

inputs.name: folderName
inputs.label: SSIS folder Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Folder in the SSIS Package Store.
